00022 //
00023 #include "chipstream/FileInbred.h"
00024 //
00025 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00026 #include "util/Fs.h"
00027 #include "util/Util.h"
00028 //
00029 #include <algorithm>
00030 #include <cctype>
00031 #include <cstring>
00032 #include <map>
00033 #include <string>
00034 #include <vector>
00035 
00036 using namespace std;
00037 // this is a monkey-see, monkey do copy of gender
00038 // ideally, we have a general sample covariate file with multiple columns
00039 // that allows us to read in whatever covariates and select the ones we need at any given time
00040 // genders and inbreeding are particular special cases
00041 // But that's probably a job for scientific programming
00042 FileInbred::FileInbred(const string &inbredFile, const vector<string> &celFiles) {
00043   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00044   double inbred;
00045   string celFileName;
00046   map<string, double> celToInbred;
00047   map<string, double>::iterator iter;
00048   //int (*fp)(int)=std::tolower;
00049 
00050   tsv.open(inbredFile);
00051   tsv.bind(0,"inbred_het_penalty", &inbred, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00052   tsv.bind(0,"cel_files", &celFileName, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00053   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) {
00054       celToInbred[Fs::basename(celFileName)] = inbred;
00055   }
00056   tsv.close();
00057 
00058   m_InbredStatus.resize(celFiles.size());
00059   for(int i = 0; i<celFiles.size(); i++) {
00060       iter = celToInbred.find(Fs::basename(celFiles[i]));
00061       if(iter == celToInbred.end())
00062       {
00063               m_InbredStatus[i] = 0; // no inbreeding penalty or bonus for this file, silent failure?
00064       }
00065       else
00066       {
00067               m_InbredStatus[i] = iter->second;
00068       }
00069   }
00070 
00071   m_InbredName="user-supplied";
00072   m_InbredDescription="user supplied inbreeding status (inbred_het_penalty)";
00073 }
